title: error: internal compiler error[E0391]: cycle detected when checking if `` is representable

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code `main.rs` ```Rust use parking_lot::Mutex; struct A(Mutex); fn main() {} ``` `Cargo.toml` ```toml [package] name = "a" version = "1.0.0" edition = "2021" [dependencies] parking_lot = "0.12.1" ``` Here's a working (technically not working) version on [Rust Explorer](https://www.rustexplorer.com/b#%2F*%0A%5Bdependencies%5D%0Aparking_lot%20%3D%20%220.12.1%22%0A*%2F%0A%0Ause%20parking_lot%3A%3AMutex%3B%0A%0Astruct%20A(Mutex%3CA%3E)%3B%0A%0Afn%20main()%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20println!(%22%22)%3B%0A%7D). ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: d5a82bbd26e1ad8b7401f6a718a9c57c96905483 commit-date: 2023-02-07 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error[E0391]: cycle detected when checking if `A` is representable --> src/main.rs:3:1 | 3 | struct A(Mutex); | ^^^^^^^^ | note: ...which requires checking if `A::0` is representable... --> src/main.rs:3:10 | 3 | struct A(Mutex); | ^^^^^^^^ = note: ...which requires checking if `lock_api::mutex::Mutex` is representable... = note: ...which requires checking if `A` is representable... = note: ...which again requires checking if `A` is representable, completing the cycle note: cycle used when checking that `A` is well-formed --> src/main.rs:3:1 | 3 | struct A(Mutex); | ^^^^^^^^ ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'DefId(20:96 ~ parking_lot[9ab4]::mutex::Mutex) does not have a "params_in_repr"', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder/cstore_impl.rs:188:1 stack backtrace: 0:
